name: Literature and Authors Quiz | Mixed Literature | 20 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote 'The Canterbury Tales'?
questions.explanation:
Geoffrey Chaucer.

	Chaucer's 'The Canterbury Tales' helped define the Middle English language, much as Dante Alighieri's 'Divine Comedy' did for Italian.

questions.text: Who won a Nobel Prize for his novel 'Dr. Zhivago', but was forced by the Soviet government to turn it down?
questions.explanation:
Boris Pasternak & Pasternak.

	Pasternak was very disappointed by those orders.

questions.text: Which of the following was written by Nobel prizewinning Egyptian writer Naguib Mahfouz?
options: Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret
questions.explanation:
Palace Walk.

	'Palace Walk' was the beginning of a multi-volume saga describing the lives of a Cairo clan, from World War I onward.

questions.text: What German author won a Nobel Prize for literature in the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
Guenter Grass.

	Guenter Grass wrote about many Germans' refusal to face the facts of the Holocaust in their literature.

questions.text: Which of Homer's works deals DIRECTLY with the Trojan War (not just its aftermath)?
questions.explanation:
The Iliad & Iliad.

	The Iliad is the story of the clash of heroes at the end of the Trojan War.

questions.text: What play, starring a character named Viola, is William Shakespeare depicted as beginning at the END of the movie 'Shakespeare in Love' (NOT during the rest of the movie)?
questions.explanation:
Twelfth Night.

	The movie alleges that the character of Viola in 'Twelfth Night' was inspired by Viola de Lessups, Shakespeare's movie love interest.

questions.text: Under what king's direction was the King James translation of the Bible developed?
questions.explanation:
King James I of England.

	The Puritans were anxious for a less Catholic edition of the Bible, and King James I agreed, and ordered a committee of scholars to produce a new translation. (He was King James VI of Scotland from an early age, and then became King James I of England as well.)

questions.text: Who wrote the play 'A Doll's House', featuring Nora Helmer and her husband Torvald?
questions.explanation: Henrik Ibsen.

questions.text: In what language did Lope de Vega, one of the most prolific playwrights of all time, write his plays?
questions.explanation:
Spanish & Espanol.

	De Vega was a contemporary of Miguel Cervantes, who wrote 'Don Quixote.'

questions.text: About whom did Abraham Lincoln say, 'So this is the little lady who started the big war'?
questions.explanation:
Harriet Beecher Stowe.

	Stowe's 'Uncle Tom's Cabin', published in the 1850s before the Civil War, inflamed the North and infuriated the South.

questions.text: Who wrote 'Rime of the Ancient Mariner'?
questions.explanation: Samuel Coleridge.

questions.text: What famous children's book did L. Frank Baum write -- a book that would become the first of a series of fourteen?
questions.correct: The Wizard of Oz & The Wonderful Wizard of Oz & Wizard of Oz & Wonderful Wizard of Oz
questions.explanation:
The Wizard of Oz & The Wonderful Wizard of Oz & Wizard of Oz & Wonderful Wizard of Oz.

	'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz' -- usually reprinted under the name 'The Wizard of Oz' -- was the first of 14 Oz novels written by Baum.

questions.text: What member of the Quiche people in Guatemala won the Nobel Peace Prize in part for her autobiography?
questions.explanation:
Rigoberta Menchu.

	In the last year, there has been a controversy as to whether her autobiography, 'I, Rigoberta Menchu' was fictionalized.

questions.text: Who wrote the mock heroic poem 'Ode on the Death of a Favorite Cat, Drowned in a Tub of Goldfishes'?
questions.explanation: Thomas Gray.

questions.text: What Shakespearean play is parodied in a scene in the Arnold Schwarzenegger flop 'Last Action Hero', widely criticized as rotten?
questions.explanation:
Hamlet.

	'Hamlet' is given an action-movie treatment in this scene near the beginning: 'Something is rotten in the state of Denmark -- and Prince Hamlet is taking out the trash.'

questions.text: What is Dr. Seuss's real name?
questions.explanation: Theodor Seuss Geisel.

questions.text: Who wrote the classic children's novel 'Matilda' and entitled his autobiography 'Boy'?
questions.explanation:
Roald Dahl.

	Also authored 'Charlie And the Chocolate Factory' and 'James And The Giant Peach', he was married to actress Patricia Neal.

questions.text: Whose 'On the Origin of Species' began a debate between science and religion that is still going on today?
questions.explanation:
Charles Darwin.

	Darwin gained the information supporting evolution by natural selection from his voyage on the H.M.S. Beagle. Some consider this scientific theory to be contrary to their religious beliefs.

questions.text: In a similar vein, the play 'Inherit the Wind' deals with what famous trial?
questions.explanation:
Scopes monkey trial.

	John Scopes, the teacher tried for teaching evolution to his 1920s class, may not actually have taught evolution to his class.

questions.text: You're almost done! So pat yourself on the back and answer one last question: what was the name of the man who wrote the 'Divine Comedy' which included the famous 'Inferno'?
questions.explanation:
Dante.

	It was Dante Alighieri.
